|action3=FAC |action3date=10:01, 19 October 2013 |action3link=Wikipedia:Featured article candidates/24th Waffen Mountain Division of the SS Karstj채ger/archive1 |action3result=promoted |action3oldid=577824913 |currentstatus=FA |topic=warfare}}
{{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WPMILHIST|class=FA|A-Class=pass|Balkan=y|German=y|Italian=y|WWII=y}} {{WikiProject Germany|class=FA|importance=low}} {{WikiProject Italy|class=FA|importance=low}} {{WikiProject Slovenia|class=FA|importance=low}} {{WikiProject Yugoslavia|class=FA|importance=low}} }} {{Australian English}}
== Comment == This is the English wiki page for the 24th Waffen Mountain Division of SS. Therefore the name should be in English instead of German. Just like all the other Division pages. --[[User:Wis|Wis]] ([[User talk:Wis|talk]]) 14:37, 27 April 2011 (UTC)
== Language == Above, it says the article is in Australian English?
The page has the feel of one based on a German-language article. Why else would the German-form of placenames be used? e.g. Karfreit for [[Kobarid]]. [[User:Nedrutland|Nedrutland]] ([[User talk:Nedrutland|talk]]) 07:56, 15 August 2016 (UTC) :It is partly based on a German-language source, and the source uses those versions of place names. Cheers, [[User:Peacemaker67|Peacemaker67]] ([[User_talk:Peacemaker67|click to talk to me]]) 08:42, 15 August 2016 (UTC)
I have now altered placenames to their accepted current form with the German version in brackets. [[User:Nedrutland|Nedrutland]] ([[User talk:Nedrutland|talk]]) 09:19, 19 August 2016 (UTC)
== ''[[Waffen-SS|Waffen]]''-SS ==
Why <nowiki>''[[Waffen-SS|Waffen]]''-SS</nowiki> and not <nowiki>[[Waffen-SS|''Waffen''-SS]]</nowiki>? The current format violates [[WP:EASTEREGG]]. [[User:Jnestorius|jnestorius]]<sup>([[User talk:Jnestorius|talk]])</sup> 14:24, 15 August 2016 (UTC)
:I see this in [[Wikipedia:Featured article candidates/24th Waffen Mountain Division of the SS Karstj채ger/archive1]] ... ::[[MOS:FOREIGN]] states that non-loanwords are italicised as foreign words not yet in everyday use in non-specialized English. There was no consensus when discuss at MILHIST Talk, so I have applied the suggested MOS rule of thumb (using the Merriam-Webster dictionary), which does not list Waffen, but does list SS. Thus Waffen is italicised and SS is not. :...which explains why ''Waffen''-SS and not ''Waffen-SS'' or Waffen-SS but does not explain the odd placement of the Wikilink. Although adiditionally the [[Waffen-SS]] article does not adopt the same italics convention. [[User:Jnestorius|jnestorius]]<sup>([[User talk:Jnestorius|talk]])</sup> 14:29, 15 August 2016 (UTC)
::And indeed the [[Wikipedia:Today's featured article/August 15, 2016]] blurb uses <nowiki>[[Waffen-SS]]</nowiki>. [[User:Jnestorius|jnestorius]]<sup>([[User talk:Jnestorius|talk]])</sup> 14:31, 15 August 2016 (UTC) :::I think the rationale above explains the italicisation (based on ''Waffen'' not being in the dictionary), so it should be <nowiki>[[Waffen-SS|''Waffen''-SS]]</nowiki>. I can't speak for the ''Waffen''-SS article, although I think I've been consistent on the four FAs on Balkan ''Waffen''-SS divisions I've done (13, 21, 23 and this one, plus a couple of bio articles). I might start a centralised discussion to get a community consensus. Cheers, [[User:Peacemaker67|Peacemaker67]] ([[User_talk:Peacemaker67|click to talk to me]]) 00:19, 17 August 2016 (UTC)
== War crimes ==
The [http://www.axishistory.com/books/119-germany-waffen-ss/germany-waffen-ss-divisions/1313-24-waffen-gebirgs-karstjaeger-division-der-ss Axis History Factbook] notes that "This unit was involved in several war crimes against partisans and civilans including an imfamous beheading of two captured partisans. The anti-partisan war in Italy was brutal on both sides and in February 1944 15 members of the SS-Karstwehr-Batillon who had been captured by the partisans near Cividale were tortured and killed." It also provides several books where one would imagine such information is sourced from.[[User:EnigmaMcmxc|EnigmaMcmxc]] ([[User talk:EnigmaMcmxc|talk]]) 18:41, 15 August 2016 (UTC)
:Axishistory is hardly a reliable source, and the same goes for several of the sources mentioned on that page, though I'll see if I can access copies of the ones that might be reliable. Cheers, [[User:Peacemaker67|Peacemaker67]] ([[User_talk:Peacemaker67|click to talk to me]]) 23:05, 15 August 2016 (UTC)
:Not mainly anti-partisan. Mainly anti-civilian... "After the war the SS organisation as a whole was held to be a criminal organization by the post-war German government, due to evidence that it was responsible for war crimes."[[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Waffen-SS#War_crimes]] 24th escaped to Latin America. -[[User:Yohananw|Yohananw]] ([[User talk:Yohananw|talk]]) 23:41, 16 August 2016 (UTC)
